instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used for extracting built-up area (BUA) from satellite data in order to improve city planning and management?
Output: Eight textural features based on the gray-level co-occurrence matrix (GLCM) were selected and combined with multispectral data for extracting built-up area (BUA) from satellite data to improve city planning and management.

instruction: What metric was chosen for extracting built-up area (BUA) from satellite data in order to improve city planning and management and how far can this metric go in improving the results?
Output: The Kappa coefficient and overall accuracy were chosen as metrics for extracting built-up area (BUA) from satellite data to improve city planning and management. This metric can improve the overall accuracy of linear-SVM by 8.41%, radial basis function SVM by 8.3%, BP-NN by 7.63%, and k-NN by 6.6%.

instruction: What machine learning models were used  for extracting built-up area (BUA) from satellite data in order to improve city planning and management to compare the accuracy of the results?
Output: The machine learning models used  for extracting built-up area (BUA) from satellite data in order to improve city planning and management to compare the accuracy of the results were support vector machine (SVM), k-nearest neighbor (k-NN), and backpropagation neural network (BP-NN).

instruction: Can the proposed advanced automated method for extracting BUA from satellite data be considered superior to traditional methods in improving the accuracy of classification?
Output: Yes, the proposed advanced automated method for extracting BUA from satellite data can be considered superior to traditional methods in improving the accuracy of classification. The related study states that the traditionally used optical data present spectral confusion, making it difficult to accurately identify BUAs. The advanced method combines eight textural features based on the gray-level co-occurrence matrix with multispectral data and uses feature selection methods to train a support vector machine (SVM) classifier. The results show that the proposed approach increases the overall accuracy of classification compared to traditional methods such as k-nearest neighbor (k-NN) and backpropagation neural network (BP-NN). The improvements in accuracy range from 6.6% to 8.41%, indicating that the advanced automated method is more effective in accurately classifying BUAs.
